meanings.definition: Of or relating to Faraday or his work.
meanings.sent1: The faradic experiments conducted by Faraday were groundbreaking.
meanings.sent2: Her research focused on the faradic principles discovered by Faraday.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled as they tried to replicate the faradic experiments of Faraday.
meanings.sent4: His faradic discoveries illuminated the scientific community.
meanings.sent5: The faradic concepts of Faraday sparked a revolution in electricity.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the electric current produced by a Faraday coil or transformer.
meanings.sent1: The faradic current from the transformer powered the machine.
meanings.sent2: She studied the faradic effects of the coil on different materials.
meanings.sent3: The robot danced erratically due to the faradic energy from the coil.
meanings.sent4: The faradic power surged through the wires like a wild river.
meanings.sent5: The faradic pulses from the transformer hummed with energy.
